abstracts.cdata!:
The Urgent Electricity Rehabilitation
            Project (UERP) for Rwanda intends to rehabilitate and
            establish new transmission and distribution networks for
            electricity in Kigali and precisely in Gasabo district with
            the sole purpose of increasing access to electricity to the
            residents of Kigali thereby enhancing growth and trade
            through energy access. Negative impacts include: destruction
            of vegetation and crops, temporary and permanent land loss,
            localized soil erosion, localized dust related and noise
            impact during construction, borrow pit impacts, workers
            health and safety, bird strikes/collusions, and aesthetics
            and visual related impacts. Mitigation measures include: 1)
            avoid siting lines through protected areas, other
            environmentally sensitive areas or through mature forest
            stands; 2) string conductors under tension to minimize
            potential damage to remaining ground vegetation; 3) borrow
            pit areas (if any) should avoid other non site areas; borrow
            areas should be reworked to blend into the surroundings.
            Re-vegetation should be performed using local plants. All
            slopes and working surfaces should be returned to a stable
            condition; 4) the entire workforce of the plant should be
            trained in the use of protective gear, handling of electric
            safety equipment, fire protection and prevention, emergency
            response and care procedures. Training given to the
            employees should be backed by regular on- site training in
            safety measures; 5) the construction site for the 4 mini
            substations must contain fire fighting equipments of
            recommended standards and in key strategic points all over
            the site. At minimum at least, carbon dioxide systems, and
            portable fire extinguishers should be installed in the cabin
            construction site; 6) the contractor should engage a refuse
            handling company to remove the wastes from the site to the
            recommended waste disposal site; 7) the project routing has
            been designed to avoid any ecologically sensitive areas
            especially wetlands.  In cases where the route will cut
            across a wetland, minimal disturbance should be observed; 8)
            the contractor should aim to keep to areas of lower
            elevation as far as possible, in order to minimize the
            visual impacts associated with the proposed Transmission
            line; and 9) dust-suppression techniques should be used
            along gravel roads, when required.
